1010.2: It's even more amazing than I'd imagined!
1010.3: But my visions were of fire | and war.
1010.8: Drenden. | Where's the rest of the Council?
1010.11: All this time, | and you never once sensed my presence.
1010.12: [chuckling] Oh. | It's not time for that yet.
1010.13: But if you're so eager for a fight, | perhaps this can keep you occupied.

1012.4:
[Xal'atath]
This city is home to such power, | all squandered by the Kirin Tor.
1012.5: I'll put it to much better use.

1013.3: Now, with this power, | all Earthen | shall awaken.
1013.10: I've seen you wield Azeroth's gift.
1013.12: You're the only one who can save them.
1013.17: Azeroth, let your blessing | pass to them.

1014.8:
You're here to tell me
we don't get to hide.
1014.12: But time by itself heals nothing.
1014.13: You didn't just come here for me.
1014.17:
Something, | someone, | is calling out
from the heart of the world.
1014.18: Like a voice from a dream.
1014.21: The world needs your Light again.
1014.25: I am not that person anymore!
1014.29: You are not your past, Anduin.
1014.38: But we were drawn here by the voice.
1014.42: But that sword | was aimed at someone.

1020.1:
[Queen Ansurek]
And this I promise to you all.
1020.2: With our renewed strength, | our kingdom shall be reborn!
1020.4: I can feel the Void's influence upon her.
1020.17: [nerubian guard] Get the queen to safety!

1021.2:
[Ansurek] Slender is the strand
that guides our destiny, | known only by true sacrifice.
1021.3:
In our kingdom of Azj-Kahet, | no one understood this sacrifice
more than Queen Neferess...
1021.5:
I saw this when the Black Empire came | to conscript us
for their last stand at Ny'alotha. | My mother refused them.
1021.6: [minion] For this treachery, | your line will sever itself!
1021.7: [grunts] This kingdom will wither | with the waning of your will--
1021.9:
[Ansurek] Our strength defined us
that day. | And in that moment, | we felt destined for greatness. | But in the years that followed, | our greatness was tarnished.
1021.10:
Look at them out there. | -[indistinct yelling]
-[Ansurek] Wretched. | Starving.
1021.11:
[Neferess sighs] I am not immune
to our people's suffering. | I believe better days will come.
1021.12:
[Ansurek] Not if you keep failing
to seize the moment. | What was the point
of you freeing our future, | only to leave us buried in the past?
1021.13:
[Neferess sighs] You comprehend so little. | There is much for you to learn
before you can be queen.
1021.17:
[Xal'atath] You have heard my voice
in your dreams, Great Queen.
1021.19: [Xal'atath] Yes, of the empire that was. | But the Old Gods are dead, | the empire lies in ashes, | and a shadow has fallen on your kingdom.
1021.20: But the blood of the Old Gods... | can make your people powerful again. | Your reign could last for eternity. | All you have to do is take my hand.
1021.21:
[Neferess] Your words are tempting, | but the cost is too great. | I would never risk my kingdom
for such power.
1021.22:
-[flame crackling]
-[Ansurek] Mother. | Who are you talking to?
1021.23: [Neferess sighs] Ghosts, dearest. | As always, they are my ready counsel.
1021.24:
[Ansurek] I'm not sorry for what I said. | I only want our people
to be great once more.
1021.25: [Neferess] Greatness is fleeting. | What we must do now is endure. | Your time will come, child, | but only when you are rea-- [gasps]
1021.29:
[Ansurek] You are not
the only one seeing ghosts, | Mother.
1021.30:
[Xal'atath] How sad, | to have a queen so wise, | and yet so ignorant
to the call of destiny.
1021.35: With this power, | Azj-Kahet is unbound.
1021.36: We will rise. | We will conquer. | And together, | we will finally claim our destiny!

1024.1:
[narrator] From the moment
the Dark Titan Sargeras | plunged his colossal blade into our world, | crucial events were set in motion.
1024.2:
Magni Bronzebeard heard
the cries of Azeroth, | giving up everything to answer her call.
1024.3: Since being wounded by the Mad Titan, | Azeroth has been crying out in pain.
1024.4:
[narrator] As her dutiful Speaker, | he rallied the champions to her aid,
and ultimately, | to confront the return
of the Old God N'Zoth.
1024.5:
It was during this conflict
that Xal'atath, | a mysterious entity of the Void, | made a deal with N'Zoth, | freeing her from the cursed blade
that bound her essence within.
1024.6: [Xal'atath] Honor our bargain. | Free me to find my own fate.
1024.7:
[narrator] After she vanished
into the darkness, | N'Zoth was confronted
by the mortal champions | and destroyed, | ending the Old Gods' reign of terror.
1024.8:
But they were not
the only malevolent force | with its eyes set on Azeroth.
1024.9:
For soon, the sky was sundered, | the Shadowlands split open, | and our heroes were pulled
into the realm of Death itself.
1024.11:
[narrator] It was there
that Anduin Wrynn endured the worst.
1024.12: Captured, tortured, | and through dark Domination magics | forced to commit terrible acts | against his will.
1024.13: I'm afraid that if I call on the Light, | it won't answer.
1024.14:
[narrator] Scarred and shaken
by his experience, | he vanished, his whereabouts unknown.
1024.15:
After the threat of the Shadowlands
had been quelled, | the dragons of Azeroth returned
to their ancestral homeland.
1024.16:
It was here that
the Primal dragon Iridikron | broke free of his prison.
1024.17:
And in pursuit of vengeance
upon the Titans, | who he felt had stolen our world, | he secured an ancient, powerful artifact - | the Dark Heart.
1024.18:
When the Titans come
to reclaim their prize, | I will be waiting.
1024.19:
[narrator] As word of this new threat
started to spread, | people began experiencing strange visions.
1024.22:
[Khadgar] It's being heard
all across Azeroth.
1024.23:
The Council doesn't know
what to make of it.
1024.24:
[narrator] It was then
that Alleria Windrunner, | a deadly huntress
who had harnessed the powers of the Void | as a weapon against the darkness, | was summoned to investigate.
1024.25:
We still don't know
what this Dark Heart relic is capable of, | but we do know it's in the hands
of someone called the Harbinger.
1024.26:
[narrator] It was not long before Alleria
discovered the Harbinger's true identity - | Xal'atath.
1024.27:
The mysterious figure
was once again on the move.
1024.28:
While neither Xal'atath
nor the Dark Heart could be found, | her mentor, | the enigmatic Locus-Walker, | issued Alleria a dire warning.
1024.29:
[Locus-Walker]
The radiant visions you spoke of | are the very same my people had | before our world was consumed
by the Void Lord Dimensius.
1024.30:
Could Xal'atath be seeking
that same fate for Azeroth?
1024.31:
[Locus-Walker]
You must find a way to stop her.
1024.32: If you cannot, | then Azeroth is already doomed.

1025.2:
You know, Alleria, | you mortals are the most
wrathful creatures in existence.
1025.3:
I've watched you break worlds,
overthrow gods.
1025.4: Even the realm of death couldn't hold you.
1025.5: Your hunger for violence | is insatiable.
1025.6: You lured us here, | unleashed us upon the Nerubians.
1025.7:
[Xal'atath] All to fuel
the Black Blood's power.
1025.12:
But I have risen from the ashes
of countless empires.
1025.13:
I have survived ordeals
you cannot comprehend.
1025.27: I knewâ€¦ you... | would stop her.
1025.28: Stay with me, Khadgar. | Don't let go.
